title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
asdfasdf left at 01:23 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out)  
asdfasdf joined #xwiki at 01:23  
asdfasdf left at 02:31 (zelazny.freenode.net irc.freenode.net  
xwiki-bridge left at 02:54 (Killed by sagan.freenode.net (Nick collision)  
xwiki-bridge joined #xwiki at 02:54  
asdfasdf joined #xwiki at 02:54  
sunny\_slls joined #xwiki at 05:14  
sunny\_slls - (05:31): hello everybody  
sunny\_slls - (05:32): is it necessary that to get through the javadoc API scripting you need to have a good knowledge about the "java.util" and "java.awt" packages?  
sunny\_slls - (05:34): xwiki-bridge, ?  
sunny\_slls - (05:45): xwiki-bridge, hello is there anyone?  
sunny\_slls - (05:46): please help me with my query  
sunny\_slls - (05:47): hello SvenDowideit   
sunny\_slls left at 05:52 ("?? " ?? ???? ????? " ??"  
CalebJamesDeLisl joined #xwiki at 05:55  
SvenDowiu joined #xwiki at 07:19  
SvenDowideit left at 07:32 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out)  
SvenDowiu is now known as SvenDowideit ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
kibahop joined #xwiki at 08:59  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:22  
lucaa left #xwiki at 09:22  
xwiki-bridge - (09:33): [vmassol] sdumitriu: good morning  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:40): Good morning all, Thanks Vincent for the input. The only reason I wanted access to the configuration was for things which are currently static but should be dynamic like "XWiki", "xredirect" and such.  
xwiki-bridge - (09:40): [vmassol] Hi Caleb  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:41): None of those things are critical.  
xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [vmassol] ok then they should be retrieved from their associated domain module  
xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [vmassol] for example for XWiki that would be ModelConfiguration  
xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [vmassol] s/XWiki/"XWiki"/  
xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [vmassol] err actually it's not the right module  
xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [vmassol] don't know what "XWiki" is  
xwiki-bridge - (09:41): [vmassol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [vmassol] is it the space where users are stored?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:42): Yes.  
xwiki-bridge - (09:42): [vmassol] if so then it should be retrieved from the authentication module's configuration component when we have one  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:43): If there is no problem with people getting the captcha wrong and thus not being told that the username they chose is taken, then those things are not necessary.  
xwiki-bridge - (09:43): [vmassol] you don't need config for that IMO  
xwiki-bridge - (09:44): [vmassol] and yes being told that the name is already taken is a good thing to have  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:44): That was referring to the other two methods.  
xwiki-bridge - (09:44): [vmassol] ok  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:44): Actually I could do a rough check using exists, but it wouldn't support regex or the superuser's name.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:45): Something else: can you get me in to the incubator.myxwiki so I can have a look at their registration mockup?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:45): user: http://www.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/CalebJamesDeLisle  
xwiki-bridge - (09:50): [vmassol] Caleb: done  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:51): Thanks. Also I am not able to set security level on some modules (XWIKI) while others (XPMAIL) I am.  
kibahop left #xwiki at 09:59  
xwiki-bridge - (10:05): [vmassol] Caleb: checking for jira  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:05): What's that?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:05): [vmassol] " Also I am not able to set security level on some modules (XWIKI) while others (XPMAIL) I am.". I'm assuming you're talking about jira  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:06): Oh yes, sorry for mot being more specific.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:06): s/mot/not  
xwiki-bridge - (10:08): [vmassol] caleb: should be ok  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:08): thank you, I just got to http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/register/XWiki/Register and I get "You are not allowed to view this document"  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:09): Sorry for so much work on a Monday morning...  
xwiki-bridge - (10:09): [vmassol] np :)  
xwiki-bridge - (10:10): [vmassol] caleb: register is only avail to admins on incubator  
xwiki-bridge - (10:10): [vmassol] you're not supposed to use it that's why we've protected it  
xwiki-bridge - (10:10): [vmassol] what's your need?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:11): [vmassol] to modify it?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:11): [vmassol] (for putting the captcha and trying it out on incubator?)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:11): Okay, Guillaume told me that it was a mockup for a new registration system.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:11): I wanted to look at it.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:11): Maybe the mockup is somewhere else in Incubator, I'll look around.  
xwiki-bridge - (10:11): [vmassol] no I think you misunderstood it must somewhere else  
xwiki-bridge - (10:12): [vmassol] I've just looked at it and it's the standard registration form  
xwiki-bridge - (10:13): [vmassol] we can ask guillaume when he's connected  
xwiki-bridge - (10:13): [vmassol] shouldn't be long now  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:16): Ok, jira is working too, thanks.  
xwiki-bridge - (10:30): [vmassol] glerouge: hi, Caleb has a question for you re the registration screen  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:32): gleruuge: You said there was an example at http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/register/XWiki/Register but Vincent has told me that is just the default registration page.  
xwiki-bridge - (10:32): [glerouge] not quite  
xwiki-bridge - (10:32): [glerouge] when you start typing into field you've got immediate JS validation  
xwiki-bridge - (10:32): [glerouge] in the current form there is no form of validation whatsoever  
KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 10:32  
xwiki-bridge - (10:33): [glerouge] which means that when one inputs a not allowed username or 2 password that don't match the registration doesn't take place  
xwiki-bridge - (10:33): [glerouge] but the user has no feedback about why it failed  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:33): I can't view that page because it's for admins only, can you get me the velocity template?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:33): [glerouge] I'll give you the proper rights on incubator  
xwiki-bridge - (10:33): [glerouge] do you have a user there ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:34): http://www.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/CalebJamesDeLisle  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:34): Vincent just got me access to the incubator.  
xwiki-bridge - (10:34): [glerouge] ok, cool  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:35): Sorry for bungling your name gleruuge, I type too fast.  
xwiki-bridge - (10:36): [glerouge] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (10:36): [glerouge] use tab to autocomplete ;)  
xwiki-bridge - (10:37): [vmassol] he cannot since he's on irc... why don't you join us on jabber btw caleb?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:38): There's another question I have for everyone who uses Jabber. What is the ip address for conference.jabber.org? I have a couple of dns servers and none can find it.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:39): It's odd because I have my isp's dns server, opendns and my own caching dns server, nobody can give me the address.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:40): Even nwtools.com can't get the address...  ????  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 11:05  
Lukemon joined #xwiki at 12:22  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 13:08  
xwiki-bridge left at 13:09 (Remote closed the connection  
xwiki-bridge joined #xwiki at 13:09  
xwiki-bridge - (13:09): \* sdumitriu has set the subject to: XWiki Chat - http://www.xwiki.org/  
xwiki-bridge - (13:09): [jvdrean] the checker only monitors the process, not the actual connections; I've restarted it manualluy  
sdumitriu - (13:10): CalebJamesDeLisl: Don't know if you received this, since the bridge has been dead  
sdumitriu - (13:10): (11:58:48 AM) sdumitriu: Hm strange:  
sdumitriu - (13:10): ping conference.jabber.org  
sdumitriu - (13:10): ping: unknown host conference.jabber.org  
sdumitriu - (13:10): (11:59:21 AM) sdumitriu: jabber.org is 208.68.163.220  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:10): Hmm.  
xwiki-bridge - (13:11): [sdumitriu] Caleb, I'd like to push faster the object loading improvement  
xwiki-bridge - (13:11): [sdumitriu] What's the status on it?  
sdumitriu left at 13:11 (Client Quit  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:12): It works, in order to apply it, there has to be a change made to the way ListProperty.equals works  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:14): Basically what happens is Hibernate compares a ListProperty to a BaseProperty and because the BaseProperty has no listValue there is an NPE.  
xwiki-bridge - (13:19): [vmassol] fyi finishing a new large refactoring to use references. Doing some tests and then I'll commit. in about 1 hour  
Lukemon left at 13:48 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out)  
Lukemon joined #xwiki at 13:49  
xwiki-bridge - (13:49): [sdumitriu] Hei CalebJamesDeLisle  
xwiki-bridge - (13:49): [sdumitriu] Welcome to Jabber  
xwiki-bridge - (13:50): [vmassol] you made it! :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:51): Yup, but no black background!  
xwiki-bridge - (13:54): [CalebJamesDeLisle] It took me a few minutes to get the text huge, still have to work on that background, white is for documents.  
xwiki-bridge - (13:54): [CalebJamesDeLisle] I get to have the e on my name though :)  
xwiki-bridge - (13:56): [vmassol] large commit done...  
xwiki-bridge - (14:01): [glerouge] CalebJamesDeLisle: one thing to keep in mind while working on the registration page: it has to work when called from XWiki Administration > Users too  
xwiki-bridge - (14:01): [glerouge] (might have an impact on JS code)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:03): [CalebJamesDeLisle] I still can't get at the incubator registration page, if you can get me the registerinline.vm that would be excellent.  
Lukemon\_ joined #xwiki at 14:09  
xwiki-bridge - (14:13): [lucaa] hi devs  
xwiki-bridge - (14:13): [lucaa] I would like to converge on an approach for the object references since I kindof need it fast  
xwiki-bridge - (14:15): [lucaa] I'm thinking of modeling something in the way sergiu proposed, but for the moment implementing only the   
xwiki-bridge - (14:15): [lucaa] docref^classname[objnumber]#property   
xwiki-bridge - (14:15): [lucaa] part, and only defining the object & property entity types, since this seems to be the most agreed syntax, with multivalued references  
xwiki-bridge - (14:16): [lucaa] wdyt? (I would send a mail for a vote as soon as I clearify it a bit and make sure it has more chances to converge)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:17): [vmassol] lucaa: "only"? What else is there?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:18): [lucaa] in sergiu's proposal is also access to class definitions and property definitions with similar syntax  
xwiki-bridge - (14:18): [lucaa] which is not needed ftm so we could postpone it  
xwiki-bridge - (14:18): [lucaa] (I mean I don;t need it and I don't know of somebody else)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:19): [sdumitriu] Yes, we can drop class reference for the moment  
xwiki-bridge - (14:19): [lucaa] s/access/reference/  
xwiki-bridge - (14:19): [lucaa] also, vmassol, any new ideas for the multivalued references?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:19): [sdumitriu] Well, one thing to decide is whether we want ^classname as a reference or not  
xwiki-bridge - (14:20): [lucaa] you mean not indexed?  
Lukemon left at 14:20 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:20): [sdumitriu] We can solve the "indexed" issue by saying that ^classname is not valid, and ^classname[index] is the actual full reference, it's not an indexed thing  
xwiki-bridge - (14:20): [glerouge] CalebJamesDeLisle: should be ok now  
xwiki-bridge - (14:21): [glerouge] (accessing incubator)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:21): [lucaa] yes, we had a discussion with vmassol about that. To say that className[objnumber] is the value of an object ref and it would need to be handled by whoever can understand it  
sunny\_slls joined #xwiki at 14:21  
xwiki-bridge - (14:21): [lucaa] this is another option, which would integrate better with a potential plan of giving names to objects, making them accessible through more precise refs than index in an array  
xwiki-bridge - (14:22): [sdumitriu] That's too big  
xwiki-bridge - (14:22): [lucaa] sdumitriu: talking to me?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:22): glerouge: Yes, thank you.      I likes my xchat.  
xwiki-bridge - (14:22): [sdumitriu] Yes  
xwiki-bridge - (14:22): [sdumitriu] Hm, we could use the guid  
sunny\_slls - (14:22): hi everybody  
xwiki-bridge - (14:22): [sdumitriu] Hi sunny\_slls  
xwiki-bridge - (14:23): [lucaa] sdumitriu: how would guid integrate with existing APi?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:23): [sdumitriu] Poorly  
sunny\_slls - (14:23): its good to see you sdumitriu  
xwiki-bridge - (14:23): [lucaa] can I $xwiki.getObject(guid) ?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:23): [sdumitriu] Not yet  
xwiki-bridge - (14:23): [sdumitriu] But GUIDs are for the future IMO  
xwiki-bridge - (14:23): [lucaa] then it doesn't help that much  
xwiki-bridge - (14:23): [lucaa] although it's a good idea  
xwiki-bridge - (14:23): [sdumitriu] So we should introduce this API  
xwiki-bridge - (14:24): [lucaa] but in this case, it would be hard to build these refs manually  
xwiki-bridge - (14:24): [vmassol] not sure what guid has to do with the discussion re references?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:24): [lucaa] vmassol: using it as an object name  
xwiki-bridge - (14:24): [vmassol] definitely not  
xwiki-bridge - (14:24): [vmassol] guid are technical ids  
xwiki-bridge - (14:24): [vmassol] not meant for human beings  
xwiki-bridge - (14:25): [sdumitriu] Gotta go  
xwiki-bridge - (14:25): [sdumitriu] bbl  
xwiki-bridge - (14:25): [lucaa] sdumitriu: how much later?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:27): [lucaa] in the idea that an entity reference, as it is now, will have a getPosition() and return always 0 to it,  
xwiki-bridge - (14:27): [lucaa] another option to solve docref^className is to handle it as any other non indexed reference, meaning to return 0 for position, in which case it would mean "first" object of that class in the referenced doc  
xwiki-bridge - (14:28): [lucaa] however, there is an implementation detail that will make that hard to achieve, namely the way the object indexes are assigned and interpreted (the only object of a type in the doc is not necessarily with index 0)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:30): [lucaa] so, because of this, maybe it's better to use className[objnumber] as an "object name" and have the user of this reference interpret its value, it could handle 'className' value as the 'first' object of that class, regardless of the actual index  
xwiki-bridge - (14:33): [vmassol] lucaa: I like considering "classname[whatever]" as the name but it has some drawbacks: you need to reimplement: resolver, serializer + data object to hold the resolved values  
xwiki-bridge - (14:34): [lucaa] vmassol: I know, that's the bad part of it  
xwiki-bridge - (14:34): [lucaa] I just had another idea: add isMultivalued() (or a decent name) to EntityReference and assign semantic to getPosition() only when isMultivalued() returns true  
xwiki-bridge - (14:34): [lucaa] I don't like it, but it would solve the issue  
xwiki-bridge - (14:35): [vmassol] that's what I was saying the other day  
xwiki-bridge - (14:35): [lucaa] (and give more info to caller about the original ref)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:35): [vmassol] but  a clean impl of this has 2 classes  
xwiki-bridge - (14:35): [vmassol] EntityReference + IndexedEntityReference   
xwiki-bridge - (14:35): [lucaa] yes  
xwiki-bridge - (14:35): [lucaa] is that bad?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:36): [vmassol] no  
xwiki-bridge - (14:36): [vmassol] it just need to be designed  
xwiki-bridge - (14:36): [vmassol] having casts is not a sign a good design  
xwiki-bridge - (14:36): [vmassol] s/a good/of good/  
xwiki-bridge - (14:37): [vmassol] so the current api would need to be revisited in light of this and a proposal made  
xwiki-bridge - (14:37): [lucaa] well no, it would just be EntityRef as interface with 2 aditional functions: isMultivalued() and getPosition()  
xwiki-bridge - (14:37): [vmassol] a proposal that would preferably not have the user use a cast  
xwiki-bridge - (14:39): [vmassol] maybe a cast would be ok though  
xwiki-bridge - (14:41): [lucaa] well, I don't like the idea of a cast either  
xwiki-bridge - (14:41): [lucaa] cast would be nice if casting would allow getting additional information, but in this case, not casting would mean losing information  
xwiki-bridge - (14:41): [lucaa] getting an incomplete reference  
xwiki-bridge - (14:44): [vmassol] not sure we're talking about the same thing, the cast would give you access to getPosition()   
xwiki-bridge - (14:44): [vmassol] you wouldn't loose information  
xwiki-bridge - (14:55): [lucaa] what I mean is that a user that doesn't know he has to cast to indexed ref or try to cast or so on, would get incomplete information from that entity reference, all object references would be the same for him  
xwiki-bridge - (14:55): [lucaa] I don't think I can express that very well  
xwiki-bridge - (14:55): [vmassol] well that's the point of interfaces :)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:55): [vmassol] to provide a given view of something  
Enygma`1 joined #xwiki at 14:55  
Enygma` left at 14:56 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:56): [vmassol] but indeed as I said the api needs to be revisited in view of this if you want to go ahead with this  
xwiki-bridge - (14:56): [lucaa] but in this case, this view, provides a truncated view, and I don't think it;s the right place to have that  
Enygma`1 is now known as Enygma` (n=Enygma`@92.83.185.60  
xwiki-bridge - (14:57): [lucaa] I want to go ahead with something that would enable object references, I don't have very strong preferences, I'm trying to find the best way  
xwiki-bridge - (14:57): [vmassol] lucaa: it may not be a problem. When you build an ObjectReference you'd get the typed object returned  
xwiki-bridge - (14:58): [vmassol] the only potential "issue" is when you use the generic api  
xwiki-bridge - (14:58): [lucaa] ah, right, we have special implementations for all ref types  
xwiki-bridge - (15:08): [lucaa] vmassol: however, for the same reason (that we'd have ObjectReference interface), if we use className[index] as the name of an object reference, all the intermediary types & code used for handling the className[index] value would be hidden to the user: it's just more code, but it's a nicer interface. It would still be problematic if handled with the generic api though  
xwiki-bridge - (15:17): [vmassol] lucaa: I don't understand  
xwiki-bridge - (15:18): [lucaa] I mean the problem of parsing & serializing className[objectnumber] strings, if used as name of the object reference, would be hidden from the API caller behind the ObjectReference API  
xwiki-bridge - (15:19): [lucaa] the only problem with this approach (considering className[objnumber] as the ref name) is that it would require more code, but it won't be a burden for the API caller if he uses the ObjectReference  
xwiki-bridge - (15:19): [lucaa] so it's kindof the same from the API pov...  
sunny\_slls left at 15:19 ("?? " ?? ???? ????? " ??"  
xwiki-bridge - (15:21): [vmassol] lucaa: I wouldn't like to do that  
xwiki-bridge - (15:21): [vmassol] for lots of reason  
xwiki-bridge - (15:21): [vmassol] one of which is that you can have an invalid ObjectReference constructed  
xwiki-bridge - (15:21): [vmassol] and you'll only know when you use it  
xwiki-bridge - (15:21): [vmassol] this violates the rule we've set so far on references  
xwiki-bridge - (15:22): [lucaa] "invalid" such as?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:22): [vmassol] example:  
xwiki-bridge - (15:22): [vmassol] "someclass[stringhere]"  
xwiki-bridge - (15:23): [vmassol] actually we could check in the constructor  
xwiki-bridge - (15:23): [vmassol] we could do the parsing there  
xwiki-bridge - (15:23): [vmassol] so forget that  
xwiki-bridge - (15:23): [vmassol] still it doesn't look right  
xwiki-bridge - (15:24): [vmassol] on a different topic, can someone confirm that BaseElement.getName() is always a document reference?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:28): [vmassol] and that it represents the reference to the document where it's located  
xwiki-bridge - (15:28): [vmassol] (be it an object or a class)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:43): [lucaa] vmassol: I just sent a resuming mail about the proposal, can you log your votes in it, please?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:48): [CalebJamesDeLisle] vmassol: You said in your email reply that registration should definitely be a template (not an application) because someone might want to register without a database. I'm wondering how registration would work without a database?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:49): [jvdrean] CalebJamesDeLisle: read: without anything imported in the database  
xwiki-bridge - (15:50): [jvdrean] but indeed a well configured database is required  
xwiki-bridge - (15:50): [CalebJamesDeLisle] Yes. without a database you get a big 500 error (which I would like to do something about sometime)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:54): [glerouge] he means without importing the default XAR (or any XAT)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:54): [vmassol] lucaa: you didn't sent a vote mail just a proposal  
xwiki-bridge - (15:54): [vmassol] s/sent/send/  
xwiki-bridge - (15:54): [lucaa] ok, resending as vote  
xwiki-bridge - (15:55): [sdumitriu] Back  
xwiki-bridge - (15:55): [CalebJamesDeLisle] Without the default XAR, the system treats everyone as admin so they can import it am I correct?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:56): [vmassol] yes  
xwiki-bridge - (15:56): [vmassol] CalebJamesDeLisle: if you get an error starting XE with an empty DB then we have a bug that needs to be fixed. It used to work fine  
xwiki-bridge - (15:57): [lucaa] sdumitriu: there's a mail now (should arrive as a vote mail right away), could you reply to it, please? thanks a lot  
xwiki-bridge - (15:57): [CalebJamesDeLisle] With no db to connect to was what I meant.  
xwiki-bridge - (15:58): [vmassol] CalebJamesDeLisle: well with no DB it's normal!  
xwiki-bridge - (15:58): [vmassol] XE requires a DB to work  
xwiki-bridge - (15:58): [CalebJamesDeLisle] It would be nice if it put up a page to help the user specify a db.  
xwiki-bridge - (15:58): [vmassol] (obviously a better error message would be nice of course ;))  
xwiki-bridge - (16:00): [CalebJamesDeLisle] So your case for wanting the registration to be a template is that a user may want to create their own wiki without importing the standard XAR?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:00): [sdumitriu] Yes  
xwiki-bridge - (16:02): [CalebJamesDeLisle] Thanks. I just wanted to have an understanding because my maniacal tenancy for cleanliness and modularity dislikes the whole template system :)  
xwiki-bridge - (16:04): [sdumitriu] Hi florinciu, the title for XOFFICE-188 is not very clear, could you make it better, or explain what it means? It looks a bit like internal technical details, but issue names should be meaningful for the users  
xwiki-bridge - (16:04): [sdumitriu] Yes Caleb, ideally the whole UI should be defined inside the wiki  
xwiki-bridge - (16:05): [glerouge] CalebJamesDeLisle: indeed, a wizard to let the user configure the DB of his choice would be very cool   
xwiki-bridge - (16:05): [sdumitriu] But the wiki should work without having documents  
xwiki-bridge - (16:05): [sdumitriu] Still, we're good since we allow all the templates to be redefined inside the wiki  
xwiki-bridge - (16:07): [CalebJamesDeLisle] I feel like the hardcoded stuff should be just enough to bootstrap the soft stuff but I understand the value in a wiki working without any documents.  
xwiki-bridge - (16:08): [glerouge] CalebJamesDeLisle: note that in practice this hardly ever happens (using a wiki with no documents at all)  
xwiki-bridge - (16:16): [florinciu] hi sdumitriu: MSO 10 is a section in the Word output file. I'm not sure if i'll use it directly of translate it somehow. Therefor I opened the issue as a task, strictly for dev needs. But i agree I could find a more friendlier name.  
xwiki-bridge - (16:17): [vmassol] glerouge: it happens all the time  
xwiki-bridge - (16:17): [vmassol] whenever someone installs xwiki  
xwiki-bridge - (16:18): [vmassol] (installs for real I mean, not playing with the standalone installer which is not for production)  
xwiki-bridge - (16:19): [CalebJamesDeLisle] You mean it is that way until the user imports the default documents?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:20): [sdumitriu] The user (admin) might not want to import the default documents  
xwiki-bridge - (16:20): [sdumitriu] Who needs a blog, and a dashboard?  
xwiki-bridge - (16:21): [sdumitriu] We don't have a modular application manager, which would allow to pull modules as needed/wanted  
xwiki-bridge - (16:21): [vmassol] CalebJamesDeLisle: yes it is  
xwiki-bridge - (16:21): [vmassol] you install the WAR  
xwiki-bridge - (16:21): [vmassol] you start XE  
xwiki-bridge - (16:21): [vmassol] you go the admin page  
xwiki-bridge - (16:21): [vmassol] you import the default XAR  
xwiki-bridge - (16:21): [vmassol] you remove what you don't need  
xwiki-bridge - (16:21): [vmassol] ;)  
xwiki-bridge - (16:22): [CalebJamesDeLisle] If I were in charge :) I would have only enough in templates to import a document bundle.  
xwiki-bridge - (16:22): [vmassol] CalebJamesDeLisle: yes. Ok you're in charge now!  
xwiki-bridge - (16:23): [vmassol] :)  
xwiki-bridge - (16:23): [vmassol] that said you should consider that is the bare minimal wiki that would work  
xwiki-bridge - (16:23): [vmassol] s/wiki/XAR/  
xwiki-bridge - (16:23): [vmassol] s/that is/what is/  
xwiki-bridge - (16:24): [vmassol] right now it's an empty one

xwiki-bridge - (16:25): [CalebJamesDeLisle] It seems like a good idea to have an XAR which has the minimum.  
xwiki-bridge - (16:26): [CalebJamesDeLisle] I think the minimum XAR should have more than the templates have now such as user support so not everyone is treated as admin.  
xwiki-bridge - (16:27): [CalebJamesDeLisle] Should I make up a proposal email?
